DOC.brief_summary: This study is a RCT of transcranial electrical stimulation in depressed patients. Mood, cognitive test performance and biomarkers will be measured during the trial.
DOC.brief_title: Transcranial Electrical Stimulation (TES) for the Treatment of Depression.
DOC.criteria: DSMIV Major Depressive Episode (as part of a Major Depressive Disorder or Bipolar Disorder), of minimum 4 weeks duration. MADRS score â‰¥ 20 at study entry. DSMIV psychotic disorder; drug or alcohol abuse or dependence (preceding 12 months); inadequate response to ECT (current episode of depression); anticonvulsant or benzodiazepine medication; rapid clinical response required, e.g. high suicide risk; clinically defined neurological disorder or insult; metal in the cranium, skull defects, or skin lesions on scalp (cuts, abrasions, rash) at proposed electrode sites; pregnancy.
